snippet: With lodging incorporated into new airports or expansions, travelers who have long layovers or are attending conferences may not have to leave the grounds.
abstract: Robust growth in international travel in Asia, the Middle East and South America is prompting a construction boom in hotels incorporated into new airports or airport expansions; hotels take one of two forms, either as transit hotels that cater to travelers passing through, or conference center hotels that compete with in-town hotels for convention and meeting business.
lead_paragraph: With lodging incorporated into new airports or expansions, travelers who have long layovers or are attending conferences may not have to leave the grounds.

headline.main: Hotels Near the Terminal, Some Even Attached
